CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 11, 1939, pg. 20, reads: "It's a Very Good Show at Pittsburgh's Harlem Casino - 'Detroit Red,' the celebrated emcee who does her naughty but nice role in rare style, heads a fine show at Pittsburgh's Harlem Casino. Left to right, crooning Boots Swann, whose melodious voice has been a treat to nitelifers for many years; Turner and Burrelle, dancers extraordinaire; Myrtle Wilson, hipologist and charm dancer; 'Detroit Red' herself, full of pep, swing and a million jokes; Dewey Taylor, who is an artist on the mouth organ; pretty Froshine Stewart, soloist with the Sunset Royals...the supporting band for this marvelous layout.  The band is led by Little Genevieve...a maestro if there ever was one.  Gus Greenlee is the manager of the Casino."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Froshine Stewart, vocalist for Sunset Royals, standing behind microphone in front of bandstand, in Harlem Casino
